json.text: distilled from an object or fluid. It's the most fundamental part of the alchemical arts. There are eighteen types of Essentia, each bearing a particular
, groupings of Essentia types that share similar themes.
contains Essentia that represent the six core affinities of magic that most magicians are already familiar with:

. In addition to their uses for alchemy, Essentia of the House of Elements can be burned in an Eldrin Fume Filter to generate small amounts of Eldrin power (though the bottle it's carried in is, unfortunately, destroyed in the process).
what something is; if the House of Elements is about nouns, the House of Qualities is about adjectives. There are eight members of the House of Qualities:
contains four mysterious types of Essentia that represent ascending power and the search for the Philosopher's Stone:
are combinations of different Essentia that represent higher-ordered themes or ideas.

An Admixture can be composed of two to five different kinds of Essentia, always includes at least one type of Essentia of both the House of Elements and the House of Qualities, and never includes Essentia of the House of Alchemy. Some Admixtures can even include other Admixtures.
Admixtures can be obtained by distilling objects and fluids, or by combining Essentia through the alchemical process of Fixation.
is used to refer to something that could be either Essentia or an Admixture.
is to break an object or fluid down into the Materia (that is, Essentia and Admixtures) that make it up. Basic Distillation is performed at an
Devices capable of Distillation have an

rating that determines the chance that you will successfully distill each dram of Materia that the object or fluid contains. Efficiency is always noted as a percentage, and Efficiency greater than 100% has no additional effect.
is a simple device capable of performing

.

The device will only process items if placed on top of a lit Furnace, Smoker, or Blast Furnace.
The tall, leftmost slot is for fluids and is currently unimplemented.
The three slots to the left of that are for input items, which can be anything but Materia. Items placed within these slots will process one at a time, from the bottom-most slot to the top-most slot.
The nine slots to the right of the processing slot hold distilled Materia, which can only be extracted from the machine if bottles are present in the slot at the top.
The more complex devices of the alchemist’s art require a
, a ring of ensorcelled silver that focuses creative energy and Materia into a desired outcome.
, an alchemical alloy of transmuted silver, chimerite, and some Admixtures made on the Manaweaving Altar.
uses Materia to create blocks and items. A Circle of Fabrication requires

On the far left side is a panel with fifteen slots used to select what you want the Circle of Fabrication to craft. Typing in the black bar on the top of the panel filters which recipes are shown. Once a recipe is selected, it appears under the alchemical triangle in the center and a second panel appears in the lower right to indicate what Materia are required for each craft.
The alchemical triangle in the center represents the progress on the current craft, and fills as the process gets closer to completion.

To the left of the alchemical triangle are ten slots for input Materia. When a recipe is selected, two slots will be reserved for each type of Materia required by the recipe and no other types of Materia can be inserted.

In the upper right, you can set the desired FE usage of the Circle of Fabrication; as the power usage goes up, the amount of time the Circle of Fabrication requires to perform each crafting operation goes down. Changing the desired power usage will reset the progress on any current crafting operation.

Whenever the Circle of Fabrication creates a block or item, all of the Materia used is consumed and the bottles are returned into the bottle output slot. If there’s not enough space in the bottle output slot, the Circle of Fabrication won’t begin crafting until there’s enough space.
if supplied with at least one

A reagent burns for a time based on its tier. After its burn duration concludes, the Circle of Power ejects a waste product that can be reprocessed back into the reagent with Constructs. One reagent is available at Tier 2, and an additional reagent becomes available at Tier 3, Tier 4, and Tier 5.
By default, each additional reagent supplied to the Circle of Power increases its power generation twelvefold. Power is generated based on the
reagent reagent present. For example, supplying the first two reagents will generate more power than supplying only the fourth reagent.
The Circle of Power only generates up to three ticks’ worth of FE.
are the most basic energy-generating reagent used in the Circle of Power. Grains of Transmuted Silver can be made at Tier 2 by having a Construct crush a Transmuted Silver ingot.
The Grains have a very short burn time and eject a
The Tarnished Silver Lump can be crushed by a Construct back into Grains of Transmuted Silver.
is a more advanced energy-generating reagent used in the Circle of Power. Focusing Catalysts can be made at Tier 3 by pounding a block of Transmuted Silver into a
on a Runic Anvil, and Catalyst Cores can be made by performing the
Ritual of the Rod and Circle
The Catalyst has a moderate burn time and ejects a
A Construct can grind apart a Warped Focusing Catalyst, separating the
A Depleted Catalyst Core can be recharged into a Catalyst Core by smelting it in the Runeforge. This operation takes significantly longer than it normally takes to smelt an object.
Once the Catalyst Core is recharged, you can turn it back into a Focusing Catalyst by pounding the Catalyst Casing into it on a Runic Anvil.
can be used to transfer Forge Energy (FE) from a
into other devices. You can bind the Power Spike to the Circle by using the Power Spike on the Circle of Power while sneaking.
Power Spikes can insert power into any device with no range limit as long as the Circle of Power it is bound to is in a loaded chunk. Power Spikes can
draw energy from a Circle of Power.

While a determined runesmith (or a construct) can create bottles efficiently on a runic anvil, the process could always be improved.

Superheating glass panes in a Runeforge before working them on the anvil reduces the number of strikes required from four to one.

sections.value: Ritual of the Rod and Circle

json.text: This ritual binds coal, amethyst, and a few different varieties of Materia together into a
is a simple device capable of performing
A silver gear on one corner of the device can be cranked to operate the device—either manually, with a construct set to

the block, or for ten minutes by dusting it with Animus Dust.

Two corners of the device have
ports if you wish to enhance the device using Eldrin power.

The large slot in the center of the device holds the current Admixture being processed. The three slots to the left of that are for input items, which can be any Admixture.

Directly above the processing slot is a slot for bottles. Each time the centrifuge processes an Admixture, its bottle will be inserted into this slot. If there's not enough space for another bottle, the machine will stall until space is made.

The nine slots to the right of the processing slot hold separated Materia, which can only be extracted from the machine if bottles are present in the single slot above the output slots.
is to take component Materia and combine them into a new Admixture. Basic Fixation is performed at a
is to break an Admixture into the Materia (that is, Essentia or other Admixtures) that make it up. Basic Separation is performed at a

.

Devices capable of Separation have an

rating that determines the chance that you will successfully separate each dram of Materia that the Admixture is composed of. Efficiency is always noted as a percentage, and Efficiency greater than 100% has no additional effect.
is a simple device capable of performing

On the far left side is a panel with fifteen slots used to select what you want the Fusery to craft. Typing in the black bar on the top of the panel filters which recipes are shown. Once a recipe is selected, it appears under the alchemical Fixation symbol in the center and a second panel appears to the lower right to indicate what Materia are required for each craft.

The alchemical Fixation symbol in the center represents the progress on the current craft, and fills as the process gets closer to completion.

To the left of the alchemical Fixation symbol are ten slots for input Materia. When a recipe is selected, two slots will be reserved for each type of Materia required by the recipe and no other types of Materia can be inserted.

Whenever the Fusery creates an Admixture, all of the Materia used is consumed and the bottles are pushed to the bottle output slot above the alchemical Fixation symbol. If there's not enough space in the bottle output slot, excess bottles will be ejected into the world.

is a device that consumes Eldrin power (and other reagents) in order to enhance an alchemical device. The Alembic is too simple and crude to make use of Elemental Actuators, but all other devices have at least two ports that an Elemental Actuator can be plugged into.

Slotting multiple copies of an Elemental Actuator into the same device has no effect; only one of the Actuators will have any effect on the target device.

Elemental Actuators that use Earth, Water, Air, and Fire Eldrin power can be crafted at Tier 3, while those that use Arcane and Ender Eldrin power can be crafted at Tier 4.

is an Elemental Actuator that uses Earth Eldrin power. It must also be supplied with sand, some of which is consumed every operation.

When the device the Quake Refinery is modifying finishes an operation, the Grime produced is reduced and stored inside the Refinery's impressively large internal buffer.

A portion of the reduced Grime becomes Rarefied Waste instead of Alchemical Waste. The Quake Refinery doesn't need to be cleaned; waste can be directly extracted instead.

The leftmost gauge lets you tell the Quake Refinery how much Eldrin power to use each cycle. The elemental earth symbol to its right displays the amount of time remaining until more Eldrin power is consumed.
To the right of this, a thin, tall gauge shows how much Grime is currently stored inside the Quake Refinery.

In the center of the interface are three item slots. The top gauge accepts sand, which enter an internal buffer. Sand is consumed every time the linked device completes an operation. Below the sand slot are two slots that will fill with Alchemical Waste and Rarefied Waste from the Quake Refinery's Grime buffer.
To the right of this, a thin, tall gauge shows how much Sand is currently stored inside the Quake Refinery's internal buffer.

is an Elemental Actuator that uses Water Eldrin power. It must also be supplied with water, some of which is consumed every operation.

The device the Deluge Purifier is modifying benefits from increased Efficiency.

The leftmost gauge lets you tell the Deluge Purifier how much Eldrin power to use each cycle. The elemental water symbol to its right displays the amount of time remaining until more Eldrin power is consumed.

To the right of this, a wide and tall gauge acts as a tank for water, which is consumed every Eldrin power cycle.

To the right of this, a thin, tall gauge shows how much
has accumulated in the device. Whenever the targeted device finishes an operation, the Deluge Purifier generates some Steam. Steam can be used by a

. There is no negative effect to the machine if the Steam gauge is full, and excess Steam vents out harmlessly.

The rightmost area of the interface shows you how much the target device's Efficiency is being increased as well as the current amount of Eldrin power consumed every cycle.

is an Elemental Actuator that uses Fire Eldrin power. It can optionally be given fuel items, which increases the device's effectiveness.

When modifying an alchemical device that uses FE, the device's FE usage is decreased. Devices that don't use FE have their operation time reduced instead.

An Inferno Engine will also constantly operate a Distillery, Centrifuge, or Fusery.

The leftmost gauge lets you tell the Inferno Engine how much Eldrin power to use each cycle. The elemental fire symbol to its right displays the amount of time remaining until more Eldrin power is consumed.

To the right of this, a slot can be filled with fuel items to enhance the device's effectiveness. The wavy fumes above the slot show how much time is remaining on the current fuel item, much like a vanilla furnace.

To the right of this, a thin, tall gauge shows how much
has accumulated in the device. Whenever the targeted device finishes an operation, the Inferno Engine generates some Smoke. Smoke can be used by a

. There is no negative effect to the machine if the Smoke gauge is full, and excess Smoke vents out harmlessly.

The rightmost area of the interface shows you how much FE or operation time reduction the Inferno Engine is supplying as well as the current amount of Eldrin power consumed every cycle.
As an alchemical device operates, it builds up

. Successful operations produce more Grime than failed ones, and a device loses efficiency and has longer operation time when it has accumulated more than 50% of its Grime capacity.

A device can be manually cleaned with a
or automatically cleaned with a Construct bound to a

task in a Lodestar.

Cleaning a device produces
. Alchemical Waste currently has no use, but it
a favorite snack of Constructs. Do with that information what you will.

This command will cause a construct to extract materia from an alchemical device and attempt to place it in Materia Vessels within a specified area.

When emptying the alchemical device, the construct will always take materia from the largest stack first.

It requires a

This command will cause the construct to use some internally stored water to clean the Grime off of an alchemical device at the target location.

It requires a
check whether a Materia Vessel's contents are above a given percent
check whether an alchemical device's internal Grime has reached a certain percent

A Materia Vessel is an enchanted glass jar capable of holding large amounts of Materia. You can insert Materia by right clicking it with a Materia bottle, and extract its contents by right clicking with an empty bottle.

Looking at a Materia Vessel will show you the name of its contents, its alchemical formula, the current amount stored, and maximum capacity. With default configs, Materia Vessels containing Essentia can store twice as much as Materia Vessels containing Admixtures.

Materia Vessels containing Essentia also display a physical label on the front of the jar for easy reference.
An improvement on the simple Alembic, a
is an advanced form of the Alembic, capable of performing

.

Unlike the Alembic, the Distillery has a furnace built in and can supply its own heat if given fuel. The Distillery will burn fuel even if there is no item to process.

The sides of the device have Elemental Actuator ports if you wish to enhance the device using Eldrin power.
The tall, leftmost slot is for fluids and is currently unimplemented.

The six slots to the left of that are for input items, which can be anything but Materia. Items placed within these slots will process one at a time, from the bottom-most slot to the top-most slot.The large slot in the center of the device holds the current object being processed. The three slots to the left of that are for input items, which can be anything but Materia.
The eighteen slots to the right of the processing slot hold distilled Materia, which can only be extracted from the machine if bottles are present in the slot at the top.
At the bottom is a single slot that fuel items can be inserted into.
When Grime is cleaned out of an alchemical device, it produces an unpleasant, smelly residue called

.

This foul residue has precious few practical uses. Notably, it reacts well with an Admixture of Memories to create an elixir that allows an enterprising alchemist to learn from failures.

There are few safe ways to dispose of Alchemical Waste, but feeding it to a hungry Construct is known to be safe and effective. It doesn't hurt that Alchemical Waste is a beloved treat for Constructs the worlds over.
A portion of the Grime reduced by a Quake Refinery becomes

instead of Alchemical Waste.

Rarefied Waste doesn't display any of the properties of its sibling material. Instead, it can be processed in any alchemical device capable of Distillation to produce a random Admixture.

Admixtures produced by distilling Rarefied Waste are
weighted towards Admixtures of lower order.
